user_stories.title: User can log in with valid credentials
user_stories.user_story: As a registered user, I want to log in with my credentials so that I can access my personalized dashboard
user_stories.description: As a registered_user, I want User can log in with valid credentials so that I can achieve my objectives
acceptance_criteria: Given I am on the login page, When I enter my valid email and password and click login, Then I am redirected to my dashboard
Given I am logged in, When I access protected pages, Then I can view content without being prompted to log in again
Given I am on the login page, When I enter my valid credentials, Then my session is created and persists for the configured duration

user_stories.title: System rejects invalid login credentials
user_stories.user_story: As a registered user, I want the system to reject invalid credentials so that my account remains secure
user_stories.description: As a registered_user, I want System rejects invalid login credentials so that I can achieve my objectives
acceptance_criteria: Given I am on the login page, When I enter an incorrect email or password and click login, Then I see an error message 'Invalid email or password'
Given I am on the login page, When I enter invalid credentials multiple times, Then I am not locked out but see the same error message
Given I am on the login page, When I enter invalid credentials, Then my session is not created
dependencies: User can log in with valid credentials

tasks.title: Design and Implement Login Form UI Component
tasks.description: Create a responsive login form component using React with fields for email and password, including input validation states and error message display. Use Material-UI for styling consistency.
acceptance_criteria: Form includes email and password input fields
Form displays error messages for invalid inputs
Form is responsive across mobile, tablet, and desktop
Uses Material-UI components for consistent styling
technical_notes: Use React hooks for state management
Implement basic form styling with Material-UI TextField and Button
Add placeholder text and labels for accessibility

tasks.title: Implement Client-Side Form Validation
tasks.description: Add validation logic for email format and password requirements (minimum 8 characters, at least one number and special character) using a validation library like Yup or custom regex.
dependencies: Design and Implement Login Form UI Component
acceptance_criteria: Email field validates correct format (e.g., user@domain.com)
Validation errors are displayed in real-time as user types
Form submission is disabled until validation passes
technical_notes: Consider using Yup for schema-based validation
Display validation feedback with color cues (red for errors)

test_cases.title: User can successfully request a password reset

gherkin.scenario: Request password reset with valid email
given: User is on the login page
then: System displays confirmation message 'Reset link sent to your email'
User receives an email with a password reset link

test_data.expected_result: Confirmation message displayed and email sent

test_cases.expected_result: System behaves as specified in acceptance criteria

test_cases.title: System sends reset email with valid link

given: User has requested a password reset
User provided a valid registered email
then: User receives an email with a unique reset link
Reset link is valid for a limited time (e.g., 24 hours)
Email contains clear instructions for resetting password

test_data.expected_result: Email received with valid reset link

test_cases.expected_result: System behaves as specified in acceptance criteria
